title: Drag Link - Removal

body.body: If the engine has recently been running, the exhaust components may be hot to the touch. Contact with the hot components may cause damage to exposed skin. To avoid skin damage, always allow the hot parts to cool before working on the exhaust system.
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Raise and support the rear of the motorcycle under the frame and engine. Position a block to support the rear wheel.
Remove the two drag link fixings and remove the drag link. Discard the lock nuts.
Inspect the drag link bearing sleeve and spacer for any signs of damage. Replace as necessary.
